respStmt.resp: Encoded in TEI P5 XML by
respStmt.name: Salma Kamni

availability.p: The Global Medieval Sourcebook is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

projectDesc.p: Vorau Plaint of Sin is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

note.p: 'Lord, open my lips!’ This opening line, in Latin, is a quotation from Psalm 50:17.

app.lem: daz ich din lop gesprechen mege
app.rdg: that I may speak your praise.
so that I may pray to you.

app.lem: daz gib du mir heiliger crist
app.rdg: Grant this to me, holy Christ!
the true mother, the pure maiden,
In the name of the words

app.lem: der dir der engel zu sprach
app.rdg: that the angel spoke to you

app.lem: do er dir die heren botscaft
app.rdg: when he first delivered to you
the most glorious message from God,
you should today be a messenger

app.lem: zu sinen hulden hilf du mir

app.rdg: in the name of his birth –
for I know that I am guilty.

app.lem: nu biuilhe ich fruowe minen geist
app.rdg: Now, Lady, I give my spirit to you
Everything shall be bewailed to you
that has ever happened to me.
what great hope I have in you
for the salvation of my soul,
in the name of the honour

app.lem: der dir got des tages irbot
app.rdg: that God accorded to you on that day

app.lem: do er durch aller suntære not
app.rdg: when he, for the sake of the suffering of all sinners,
He chose you as a mother
I place both soul and body
in your hands in great trust.
Be a messenger today for me

app.lem: ein teil du mirs sculdig bist
daz du mir heluest umbe got

app.rdg: because you have received eternal praise
then that which God has done

app.lem: daz got mit dir getan hat
app.rdg: with you would not have happened.

app.lem: nu suche ich armer dinen rat
app.rdg: Now I, poor man, seek your guidance,
In the name of the sacred death
that the true son of God

app.lem: nune la mih under wegen niht
app.rdg: do not let me go under!
It is thanks to you that eternal light

app.lem: uber alle dise werlt ir scin
app.rdg: shines out over all the world!
So help me, a sinner, come home

because of Adam’s crime:
i.e. eating the forbidden apple.

app.lem: Nuo hore du urouwe minen ruof
dich da got zuo diu gescuof
app.rdg: For God created you for this purpose
that you might bear the burden

app.lem: do ir in dise werlt cham

app.rdg: when he came into this world.
You carried him in your womb,
you bore him, still a maiden,

app.lem: zu dem uronen sale, du in brehdest
app.rdg: you brought him to the temple,
you wrapped him in swaddling clothes.
you met him in a motherly way,

app.lem: an dinen brusten du in zuoge
app.rdg: you took him to your breast,

app.lem: in egyptum duo mit im fluohe
app.rdg: you fled with him into Egypt.

app.lem: do du diu werch mit im worhtest
app.rdg: When you undertook these acts with him,

app.lem: wie harte du sin do uorhtest
app.rdg: how frightened you were for him!

app.lem: gedruobet du an im diche wurde
app.rdg: You were often very worried about him,

app.lem: do hulue du im die burde

app.rdg: carry his burden well and gladly,

app.lem: Uil harte truoge du die burde
an dem uronen cruce sahe hangen
do er uil uerre hiebeuor sach

app.rdg: the great praise you would have

app.lem: unde al daz | der ware got
app.rdg: and all those things that the true God

app.lem: er sprach daz ein sterne solde

app.rdg: would come from the blessed Jacob

app.lem: da uone wurdest duo urouwe uernomen

app.rdg: from which a child would be born
when it happened to you thus,
that he was called your son,
From this he was well able
to count you among the stars,

app.lem: wande dich got selbe zu dem liehte wolde erwelen
app.rdg: for God himself chose you to be the light
You are like the star of the sea,
which shows the sailor the way

app.lem: uns tet diu uinstre da beuor we
app.rdg: the former darkness brought us pain –
but when you, maiden, shone out

app.lem: uon den engelen hie in erde
app.rdg: here on earth from the angels.
It is a great blessing that you

app.lem: diu under mennisken unt under gote was
app.rdg: which existed between men and God,

app.lem: mit dir zu suone hat braht
uone diu so han ich mir gedaht

app.rdg: that I, with all my misdeeds,

app.lem: Vrouw uber allez daz dir ist
app.rdg: Lady, greatest of all the things
is that you have brought praise

app.lem: du da zu den niun choren
app.rdg:
For to the nine choirs
In Christian thought, the angels are typically divided into nine groups, or choirs.
and to the apostles and to the prophets,

and the patriarchs
i.e. Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
they will be helped through your deeds.
Neither in thoughts nor in words,

app.lem: so ne chan ich uuore bringen
di guote di an dir sint

app.rdg: You are the child of the highest
and yet are also his mother.

app.lem: uone diu so tut er vrouwe
app.rdg: Because of this, lady, he does

app.lem: nun ist miner sunden nie so uil
app.rdg: My sins are not so great
that his goodness is not greater.

app.lem: ich bite dich durch sine ere
app.rdg: I pray to you in the name of his honour

which you find in a state of fear.
The passage in square brackets is inserted in the top margin of the manuscript (in the same hand).
that if you wish to free my spirit,
which is shut away from me,

app.lem: so solt du mir zehelue chomen
app.rdg: then you will come to my aid
when my life comes to an end.

app.lem: des bite ich dich durch willen der urstende
app.rdg: I ask you this in the name of the resurrection

app.lem: der der tæte uon deme grabe
app.rdg: that he carried out from his grave –

app.lem: der dich da zuo gesezet habe
app.rdg: he, who placed you on high
above all women, in all things,
and to whom all my sorrows

app.lem: ich newas ich zu niht worden
wi er mohte gezieren unde geren
unt han ich mich des selbe sit

app.rdg: He wanted me to be a companion

app.lem: daz mich des iht mege lezen

app.rdg: that these things are still open to me,
in the name of the moment

app.lem: daz dir got ie chunt wart
app.rdg: when God made himself known to you.

app.lem: nu offene mir die wider wart
app.rdg: Open up a path of return for me,
so that I may be in glory there.

app.lem: drut frouwe nuo stant mir bi

app.rdg: for I trust you in this.

app.lem: zeinem boten wis du mir gesant
app.rdg: You were sent to me to be a messenger

app.lem: an den der da wol mach
app.rdg: to him, who is well able
by bringing me from this place

quickly to that place,
i.e. from earth to heaven.

app.lem: da ich habe liep an leit
app.rdg: where I might have love without suffering

app.lem: da ich mich iemer mere mende
app.rdg: where I might rejoice for ever more,

app.lem: mit allen den die der gotes chint
app.rdg: with all those who have become the children of God
in the name of the blood

app.lem: daz got an dem cruce uz goz
app.rdg: that God shed on the cross,

app.lem: unde durch willen des wazeres daz uon siner siten floz
app.rdg: and in the name of the water that flowed from his side,

app.lem: unde hilf mir daz ich uon deme tiuuele werde enbunden
app.rdg: and help me become unbound from the devil,
in the name of the five wounds

app.lem: der got duch unsich irliten haben
app.rdg: that God suffered for our sake,

app.lem: unt durch willen aller der tage
app.rdg: and in the name of all the days

app.lem: die er uon | dir getragen wurde
app.rdg: in which he was carried by you,
and in the name of the ascension

app.lem: nu hilf mir uz dirre note
app.rdg: Help me out of this torment,
out of this evil valley of pain,

app.lem: unde brinch mich zu deme uronen sale
app.rdg: and bring me to the church

app.lem: da got den ewigen lon git

app.rdg: Queen, free at this very moment
in the name of the honour of the grave

app.lem: da der uil salige inne lach
app.rdg: in which the most sacred man lay,

app.lem: der sinen lip umbe unsich gap
app.rdg: who gave up his life for our sake.
who are healed by your works.

app.lem: du brehte in die wider uart
app.rdg: You brought them a path of return,

app.lem: uon rehte man dich bitten scol
app.rdg: it is right that we should pray to you!

app.lem: daz ir die engele sulen phlegen
app.rdg: for whom the angels must care for

app.lem: uil wil du nu heizen maht
app.rdg: It is proper that you are called

note.p: The poet uses Latin here, which he translates into German in the following line.

app.rdg: set me free from my pain,
in the name of the purity

app.lem: der ime got selbenne behielt an dir
app.rdg: that God himself maintained in you.

app.lem: des bitte ich armer minniske dich
app.rdg: I, a poor man, pray to you for this,
in the name of the suffering

app.lem: der daz herze dines sunes an dem cruce hete
app.rdg: of your son’s heart on the cross,
when, hanging from it, he met death,

app.lem: unde durch willen aller der werche da er dich ie mite fruote
app.rdg: and in the name of all the deeds through which he ever made you joyful:

app.lem: so hilf mir armen umbe got
app.rdg: help me, poor man, come to God,

app.lem: diu wort diu er selbe chot
app.rdg: those words, that he himself spoke,

app.lem: daz er diu an mir bewere
app.rdg: let him grant them in my case:

app.lem: er sprach nine wolde tot der sundare
app.rdg: he said, he wished for the death of no sinners.
In the name of St Peter,
who, for the sake of your love,

app.lem: durch die liebe daz er dich gerne gesach
app.rdg: because his love made him desire to see you,
All that I have ever done
I wish to confess my guilt for these things
and give myself to your mercy,

app.lem: unde wil dir rihten unze ich lebe
app.rdg: and I wish to turn towards you for as long as I live.
If you grant this to me,

app.lem: so sol ich ein riwesere sin
app.rdg: I will be a contrite man

app.lem: wande du herre uil wol weist
app.rdg: For you know full well, Lord,

app.lem: nu ledige herre mir diu bant
da mide mich der ubele ualant

app.rdg: I am unable to protect myself,

app.lem: Got duo solt mich alle zit bewaren
app.rdg: God, you should care for me at all times,
so that I take the right path –
I ask this of you, Lord,
in the name of the honour of the journey

app.lem: den du zu dem cruce gienge
app.rdg: that you took to the cross,
and in the name of your birth,

app.lem: deme ich ouch in rede sol gan
app.rdg: and to whom I must also speak,
in the name of your holy death:

app.lem: unde si ouch gerne buozen welle
app.rdg: and desire to do penance for them.

app.lem: des bite ich armer menske dich
app.rdg: I, a poor man, ask this of you,
in the name of the honour of all saints.

app.lem: nu hilf mir daz ich mine sele
uber den lip solt du daz rechen
daz du mich mit dinem bluote
app.rdg: for the fact that you, with your blood,
Whenever I forgot to do this

app.lem: da wil ich mir selbe umbe irteilen
app.rdg: I therefore wish to give myself
so you may judge me in this life.

app.lem: daz mir drort zeleide solde werden
app.rdg:
That I might endure pain in the other place –
I.e. in hell.
I would not like to grant myself that.
It would surely seem too long,
but it would quickly come to an end

app.lem: daz du mich sin hier ingaltestest
app.rdg: if you were to punish me here

app.lem: des sist du herre iemer gelobet
app.rdg: for this, Lord, you will always be praised!
as a poor man for my sake –

app.lem: daz ich niht enzit uof ensach
app.rdg: when I failed to consider you at all times?

app.lem: disiu werlt hat mirre zeiget daz

app.rdg: what sort of reward it offers.

app.lem: daz ir ir so uil gedienet han
app.rdg: God must have mercy upon me
for serving the world so much.
The world has deceived many a poor man
which eventually causes him to suffer
All who are in this condition

app.lem: weruen nu alle die der sin
app.rdg: should strive for the eternal realm,

app.lem: daz ist hinen uurder der rat min
app.rdg: this is my advice from now on.
Alas, how badly that man behaves
before the market to do so is gone.

app.lem: é sin sele begebe den lip
app.rdg: before his soul relinquishes his body,

app.lem: ob elleu div werlt sin eigen wære
app.rdg: when, even if he owns the whole world,
he would gladly give it away
if he believed he might be saved.
If he were to leave his body
then that is the end of him.
He whom the devil deceives thus,

app.lem: dem hat er daz halmel uor gezogen
app.rdg: making him put it [his confession] off,

app.lem: dem hat er daz halmel uor gezogen
app.rdg: that man is denied a helmet with which to defend himself,

app.lem: nu lig ich in dirre tieffe
an dine guote ich nu ruofe
app.rdg: absent from your goodness, and beg you

app.lem: daz du mir bietest dine hant

app.rdg: It was, alas, a long time ago

app.lem: do viel ich in daz unreht

app.rdg: I offer my repentance for this

app.lem: ein teil han ich irite harte [ge] gehenget
app.rdg: At times I clung to it too closely,
for you bought me, a poor man,
listen to me, a penitent man.

app.lem: ich wil mich ruogen wider dich
app.rdg: I wish to confess to you.
fall upon me, a man in sin,

app.lem: dar nah unde ich daz garnet han
app.rdg: as a result – although I have deserved it –
for then I would be lost for eternity.

app.lem: in den sunden wart ich geborn
mit sunden mich diu muoter enphie
app.rdg: my mother conceived me in sin,

app.lem: die ich auer in der toufe lie
app.rdg: which I then set aside in baptism,
when I committed myself to Christianity,

app.lem: diu han ich gare erlogen sint
app.rdg: which I have since completely denied.
For I know I am guilty.
All things in which I was diligent
you should forgive me these things
in the name of your mother’s wishes.

app.lem: ein tail ich dir nu clagen wil
app.rdg: I now want to bewail some of it to you,
which I can remember at the moment.

app.lem: unde sezze ich naht unde tach
app.rdg: And even if I sat day and night,
if I were to speak of all of it.

app.lem: do ich in der wigen lach
app.rdg: When I lay in my cradle,

app.lem: done uerliez ich nie nieneiheinen tach
app.rdg: there was no day when I did not fail
I was rarely good to her,

app.lem: so newas niuwar zorn unde nit
app.rdg: there was nothing other than anger and envy,
it was empty of righteous things.

app.lem: ich neuerliez iz nie durch daz
ich neriete ime an sine guot
app.rdg: until I had drawn him away from his goodness.

app.lem: mit den gedanchen ich in sluch
app.rdg: I battered him with my thoughts,

app.lem: ich honde in mit der zungen
app.rdg: I screamed at him with my tongue,

app.lem: so ich scolde sprechen din lop
app.rdg: When I should have spoken in praise of you
You have certainly wiped out that sin –
I can say that to you, merciful one!
I liked to rob and steal,
I did not want to be at all moderate

app.lem: dem manne ich sine konen nam
app.rdg: I took women from their husbands,
until I had fallen into sin with her,

app.lem: ode mit so getanen ge | baren
da mich auer iehtes umbe was
app.rdg:
But since it was not only about me,
This line is unclear and probably corrupted.
I always put much effort, Lord,

app.lem: der mir iht getet oder gesprach
app.rdg: Whoever did or spoke something against me –

app.lem: ich rach halt andere luote dinch
app.rdg: I took revenge on those people.

app.lem: an dinen werchen was ich blint
app.rdg: I was blind to your works,

app.lem: owi wi wol ich daz chunde
app.rdg: Alas, how easy it was for me
but now I would like it dearly.
So listen to me say this!
Even if a man had nothing,
I would cause him to lose all the wealth
I am very sorry for this.
did I ever go to confess
I was supposed to show moderation

app.lem: wande mir gnist dar ane scolde stan
app.rdg: because my salvation depended upon it,
Whenever I was supposed to fast,
who had given me this penance.
I thought I would live for ever.

app.lem: ich han uil diche einem anderen gegeben

app.rdg: regardless who had asked me to do these things.

received your holy body,
I.e. during the Eucharist
However sacred a day it was,

app.lem: ich neuerliez iz nie durch daz

app.rdg: and continued to do as I wished,
in this way I often held you in contempt.
he pleased me all the more.
I chose him as my companion.

app.lem: daz ich iz doh niemer uol zalte
app.rdg: that I will never be able to list entirely
those things through which I caused myself to fall.

app.lem: Des ich dir nu ueriehen han
app.rdg: All those things that I have just said to you,

app.lem: unde alles des des ich han getan
app.rdg: and everything that I have done,
or with any kind of thing –
through the honour of the grave

app.lem: unde durch dines heiligen crucis willen
app.rdg: and in the name of your holy cross,

app.lem: da du ane neme den tot

app.rdg: I was a weak piece of earth
that I must set myself free

app.lem: dem wurde sin gehalten ze uile
ein teil ich is nu uil

app.rdg: I would now gladly like to do penance.
Holy Christ, grant it to me

app.lem: daz gip du mir heiliger crist
uber himel und unde uber erde
nu hilf mir daz ich dir noch rehter werde
des bit ich dich durch dei gebende
app.rdg: I pray for this in the name of the binding ties

app.lem: die du doltest uon den iuden
app.rdg: you suffered at the hands of the Jews.

app.lem: nu ruche herre mich ze uridennen

app.rdg:
from the wicked dog
This and further references to the ‘dog’ refer to the devil.

app.lem: er was des leider ane mir gewis
app.rdg: He was, alas, certain of me

app.lem: des auer obe got wil nie nist
app.rdg: (although, if God wills it, it will never happen),

app.lem: daz er mich in der hant hete
app.rdg: certain he had me in his hands.

app.lem: die er mir da wolde geben
app.rdg: that he wished to give me in hell –

he should live with it for a long time in that evil place.
This line doesn’t quite make sense. Waag/Schröder and Maurer render it as vil lange im ubele haben (which [i.e. the torment] I would have in evil circumstances for a very long time).

app.lem: daz ich ir hie uerdienet habe
app.rdg: The part of this torment that I have deserved in this world –

app.lem: di nim du mir hie abe

app.rdg: so that I bring none of it
then at that moment it completely
fails to be advice of any kind!
Then they sigh only too late.
and have certainly earned your anger.

app.lem: nu weiz ich uil wol daz du bist
app.rdg: I know full well that you are
just as merciful today, as you were

app.lem: unde du ime uil wol geheize
nuo wil ich owch wider sinen
app.rdg: I, too, wish to turn back,
and wish to give myself, guilty man,

app.lem: unde wil dir rihten unze ich lebe
app.rdg: and to turn to you for as long as I live.

app.lem: nvo ist ouch billich unde reht
app.rdg: So it is both good and right

app.lem: daz duo enphahest dinen armen chouf chnet
app.rdg: that you should receive your poor servant!
in the name of the honour

app.lem: nuo gedenche ane mir der worte
app.rdg: Think, in my case, about the words

app.lem: der du spreche dinen iungeren zu
app.rdg: that you spoke to your apostles.

app.lem: ane dine helue nemohte niemen niht getun
app.rdg: Without your help no-one is able to do anything –

app.lem: Maria diu newære nie so manich iar
app.rdg: Mary would not have lived for so many years
sustained by the food of animals,

without your goodness.
The poet here refers to Mary of Egypt, a prostitute who retreats from her sins into the desert and eventually becomes a saint.

app.lem: di uns uon ir sint gescriben
app.rdg: that are written about her for us.
Whoever you want to protect, Lord,
is cared for and kept healthy.

app.lem: ia ist uns ir daz geleren
app.rdg: Indeed, we can learn from her,

app.lem: daz si sich so uerre uerworht hete

app.rdg: that the air did not allow her to enter

app.lem: zu ierusalem in daz muonster niht

app.rdg: and to do penance for her sins.

app.lem: din gnade ir sa den wech insloz
app.rdg: and your mercy enclosed her in its path.

app.lem: ouch wart si selbe so guot
app.rdg: She herself also became so good

app.lem: bist daz si der luft enbore druoc
app.rdg: that the air lifted her up,

app.lem: der ir daz munster e benam
app.rdg: which had once kept her from the temple.

app.lem: so ist mir min gemuote uil ringe
app.rdg: and my heart becomes light with joy.
you made cool for the children,

there was no heat.
The story of the youths in the fiery furnace is found in the Book of Daniel. Three young men refuse to worship the image of Nebuchadnezzar and are thrown into a furnace, but are protected by God from the flames
You sent your angel to that place

app.lem: daz er da mit samet in sanch
app.rdg: to sing your praise with them,

app.lem: Swer sich ie zuo dir geuie
app.rdg: Whoever has ever reached out for you,

good Susanna.
The story of Susanna is also found in the Book of Daniel. Susanna is falsely accused of adultery by two older men with whom she refuses to sleep; Daniel recognises her innocence.
to help her from that situation
she was in through no fault of her own.
Those who wanted to condemn her
that they, to make her suffer,
without any guilt on her part.
For this they lost your love.
who had been thrown to the lions,

app.lem: di uil lange waren hungerige gelegen
app.rdg: which had been lying, hungry, for a very long time

quickly torn him to pieces.
The Book of Daniel tells how Daniel is thrown into the lions’ den by Darius, King of Babylon, but miraculously saved by God.
They tore to pieces the people
and set it on the path of truth.
the devil wants to keep me from it in his stranglehold.
for the devil wants to keep me from my inheritance

app.lem: daz sol auer ich ein kanpf mit ime uehten
app.rdg: But if I must fight a battle with him,

app.lem: daz ich armer an im gesige
app.rdg: a poor man, have victory over him!

app.lem: owi gerne ich in uon mir uertribe
app.rdg: Oh, how gladly I would drive him from me,

app.lem: daz er mit mir nehete nechein geuerte
app.rdg: would that he had never had anything to do with me!
His reward is a hard one –
indeed, I have heard it said
and of which there will be no end

app.lem: mir wære lieber daz erz ime hete
app.rdg: I would rather that he kept them to himself.

app.lem: Ich wil ime uil gerne entinnen
app.rdg: I would dearly like to escape him
Oh, what need I have now

app.lem: daz ich hete ein brust sloz
diu brustwere darf auer niht sin
app.rdg: But the breastplate must not be
I would be killed beneath it.
in the face of the damned dog.
Then he would have to turn his arrow
away from me, like a coward,

app.lem: wane dem du sie geben wil
app.rdg: unless you give it to them.

app.lem: nuo wære rehte daz wir dich vil
app.rdg: So it would be right for us
to pray to you, frequently and inwardly,

app.lem: umbe alle die ir nine heten
app.rdg: for all those people who do not have it,
like I do not, a sinful man.
and pray to you, very keenly,
He, who likes to cleave to wealth,

app.lem: da er mir die guoten andaht
die ich zu dir scolde haben
app.rdg: which I should have directed to you.
I bewail this to your goodness:
if you do not wish to protect me
then he will bring me into trouble.
In the name of your holy death
if you were to send me, a sinner,
that it was neither of those,

app.lem:
da du mich [] uester machen
This should clearly be a couplet. There is no gap in the MS; either the scribe has miscopied the source or there was an error in the source.
app.rdg: from which you [made me]. [You did not want to [?]] make me stronger.
those who come against me, armed, every day,

app.lem:
ob sie diu gotheit
As above.
uon himele her in erde treip
app.rdg: bore you from heaven here to earth
into the womb of a poor maid,

app.lem: zu diu daz du hvlfest uf
app.rdg: so that you could help those
your goodness advised you to do it,
for we were unworthy of it.

app.lem: Wie mohte wir daz uerdienet haben
app.rdg: How could we have deserved it
that you let yourself be beaten,
that you let yourself be driven

app.lem: an die stat da man dich hie
app.rdg: to the place where you were
counted amongst those who were also there,
Oh, what godly power you have!

app.lem: do wolt er sich nider neigen
app.rdg: Then he wished to bow his head

so that, at that moment,
Christ has previously be addressed in the second person; here the address changes to the third person (before changing back again in l. 828).
He broke into hell down below.

app.lem: do du in dem tode, himel unde erde
app.rdg: When you, in death, set all of heaven and earth
the stones of hell burst asunder.

app.lem: genuo | ge erstunden an dem tage
app.rdg: Many rose up on that day

app.lem: sich zaten diu uber elliu diu lant
app.rdg: They spread out over all the land.

app.lem: waz er in der mennscheit was
app.rdg:
who he was,
I.e. Christ. clothed as a man,

app.lem: di er da uzen ane sach
app.rdg: whom he saw there outside of hell –
his godhead was hidden from him.

app.lem: daz ime ouch alle die benomen werden
app.rdg: Let those people be kept from the devil

app.lem: daz gib in unde ouch mire
app.rdg: grant this to them and also to me!
You most holy son of God,

app.lem: Qui uiuis & regnas per omnia secula seculorum.

rdg.i: qui vivis et regnas per omnia secula seculorum.

note.p: ‘Who live and reign for ever and ever.’
